Road Transport Legislation Amendment (Post-Crash Drug and Alcohol Testing) Bill 2025 [NSW]
Schedule 1   Amendment of Road Transport Act 2013 No 18
Schedule 1 
Amendment of Road Transport Act 2013 No 18
[1]
Whole Act
Omit all bracketed notes wherever occurring in headings that draw attention (“cf”) to
provisions of other Acts and statutory rules.
[2]
Section 4 Definitions
Omit the definitions of alcohol or other drug related driving offence and fatal accident
from section 4(1). 
Insert in alphabetical order—
alcohol or drug related driving offence means an offence—
(a)
involving the presence of—
(i)
alcohol in a person’s breath or blood, or
(ii)
a drug in a person’s oral fluid, blood or urine, and
(b)
prescribed by the statutory rules.
bicycle has the same meaning as in the Road Rules 2014.
crash means—
(a)
a collision between 2 or more vehicles, or
(b)
a collision or incident involving a vehicle in which—
(i)
a person is killed or injured, or
(ii)
the vehicle or other property is damaged, or
(iii)
an animal in a person’s charge is killed or injured.
fatal crash means a crash on a road or road related area involving a motor
vehicle or bicycle that results in the death of 1 or more persons.
[3]
Section 4(1), definition of “drug”, paragraph (a)
Omit the paragraph.
[4]
Section 4(1), definition of “drug”, paragraph (d)
Insert “, other than alcohol,” after “any other substance”.
[5]
Section 4(1), definition of “major offence”, paragraph (b)
Insert “, 52A” after “51B”.
[6]
Section 9 Determination of “first offence” and “second or subsequent offence”
Omit “other” from section 9(2A)(a).
[7]
Section 13 Notes
Omit the note.
[8]
Section 59, heading
Omit the heading. Insert instead—
59
Cancellation or suspension—speeding, drug or alcohol offences
[9]
Section 59(1) and (4A)
Omit “other drug” wherever occurring. Insert instead “drug”.
